content: What;'s the recommended action if a used fails the authorization step? the spec states "This decision is communicated to the app when the EHR authorization server returns an authorization code" - but not how the error is communicated... I imagine that the callback is still called (but with no code) - is there a standard way of indicating the error?

The OAuth2 spec outlines the way errors are communicated back. Specifically, if the user denies authorization, the redirect URI should be called with an error key: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.2.1
